meanings.definition: A person who borrows something, especially money or property, with the understanding that it will be returned.
meanings.sent1: The loanees returned the book to the library on time.
meanings.sent2: The loanees borrowed some tools from their neighbor for the weekend.
meanings.sent3: The loanees accidentally left their umbrella at the park.
meanings.sent4: The loanees were like responsible bookkeepers, keeping track of everything they borrowed.
meanings.sent5: The loanees were known for always returning what they borrowed promptly.

meanings.definition: The act of borrowing something, especially money or property, with the understanding that it will be returned.
meanings.sent1: The loanees of the equipment signed the agreement form.
meanings.sent2: The loanees of the funds were expected to repay within a month.
meanings.sent3: The loanees of the car forgot to fill up the gas tank before returning it.
meanings.sent4: The loanees of the tools were careful not to damage them.
meanings.sent5: The loanees of the money were grateful for the trust given to them.
